title: Pumpfun ICO Announcement Triggers SOL and Memecoin Sell-off
summary: Pumpfun announced plans for a controversial ICO at $4B FDV to raise $1B, despite generating $700M in revenue. The announcement on June 3 triggered immediate dumps in SOL and major Solana memecoins like FARTCOIN.

title: Circle IPO Drives Massive Rally to $66B Market Cap
summary: Circle's IPO under ticker CRCL opened at $31 and surged to $300 within two weeks following Senate stablecoin bill passage. The company reached a $66B fully diluted market cap, exceeding USDC's total supply, and propelled Coinbase stock to $380.

title: Upbit Listings Create Predictable Pump-and-Dump Pattern
summary: Multiple Upbit listings in June (RVN, AXL, ALT, LPT) showed identical patterns of massive pumps followed by retraces with negative funding. These consistent patterns presented clear shorting opportunities for traders.

title: Polymarket-Twitter Partnership Drives UMA 60% Rally
summary: Polymarket's June 6 announcement of Twitter partnership caused UMA to spike 60% within two days. The entire pump was completely retraced within a week, demonstrating typical news-driven volatility.

title: MASK Token Exhibits Extreme 240% Pump Before 50% Crash
summary: MASK demonstrated rug-like price action similar to LAYER and WCT, pumping 240% throughout the month before crashing 50% in 3 hours on June 6. ZKJ showed even more extreme volatility with an 85% drop in hours.

title: Robinhood Launches Arbitrum-Based L2 for On-Chain Stock Trading
summary: Robinhood announced on June 30 plans to issue stocks on-chain via their own L2 built on Arbitrum Orbit stack. ARB pumped 30% the day before on insider trading but dumped on the actual announcement.

title: Rex SOL ETF with Staking Features Launches Trading
summary: News of Rex SOL ETF with staking starting trading on July 2 pushed SOL from $150 to $160 on June 30. The pump was entirely retraced in one day, while Blockworks reported SOL ETF approval likely within weeks.

title: Trump Wallet Controversy Leads to Cease-and-Desist Order
summary: TRUMP memecoin team's June 3 announcement of Trump wallet with Magic Eden caused brief 6% pump before Trump sons denied involvement. World Liberty Financial sent cease-and-desist on June 5, forcing site offline, though teams later aligned with WLFI purchasing TRUMP tokens.

title: Bitcoin Ranges Around $105k Amid Geopolitical Tensions
summary: BTC spent June in 'summer chop' mode around $105k with two notable dips: to $100.4k on June 5 during Elon-Trump conflict and to $98k on June 22 during Iran-Israel tensions. Trump's ceasefire announcement sparked recovery to $106k while altcoins remained weak versus BTC.

title: HYPE Reaches New ATH at $46 in Continued Rally
summary: HYPE continued its unstoppable price action from April's sub-$10 bottom, breaking $40 resistance on June 10 and reaching new ATH of $46 on June 16. Despite correcting to $30, it closed June around $40, establishing itself as the cycle's main coin behind SOL.

title: Revenue-Generating DeFi Protocols SYRUP and LQTY Surge
summary: Maple Finance's SYRUP token pumped from $100M to $600M market cap as TVL and revenue grew steadily, while Euler's EUL gained 27% for its fifth consecutive green month. Liquity's LQTY surged 83% in June as fundamentals-driven DeFi coins attracted significant inflows.

title: Coinbase Integrates Base DEXs, AERO Rallies 57%
summary: Coinbase's June 13 announcement of Base network DEX integration into their main app allowing seamless on-chain trading sparked significant movement in AERO. The leading Base DEX token closed June with 57% returns on the integration news.

title: On-Chain Memecoins AURA, USELESS, and JOE Deliver Massive Returns
summary: Three memecoins dominated June: AURA pumped from $1M to $200M in two days, USELESS (on BONK's launchpad) rallied from $5M to $230M, and JOE grew from $15M to $70M. These coins demonstrated the continued strength of select memecoins despite broader market weakness.
